name: Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala
description: Fundamental case establishing that Parliament cannot alter the basic structure of the Constitution of India.

name: Vishaka v. State of Rajasthan
description: Established guidelines for dealing with sexual harassment at workplace before legislation was enacted.

name: Olga Tellis v. Bombay Municipal Corporation
key_finding: Right to livelihood is part of right to life
description: Case recognized the right to livelihood as an important component of right to life under Article 21.

name: M.C. Mehta v. Union of India
key_finding: Absolute liability principle in environmental cases
description: Established the principle of absolute liability in cases of hazardous industries.

name: Maneka Gandhi v. Union of India
key_finding: Right to personal liberty and due process
description: Expanded the interpretation of Article 21 to include right to travel abroad as part of personal liberty.

name: Lily Thomas vs Union of India & Ors.
key_finding: Misuse of Religious Conversion for Bigamy
description: governs the marriage laws for Hindus in India providing conditions for valid marriage divorce and other related aspects

name: A.K. Gopalan v. State of Madras
description: First major constitutional case after independence, narrowly interpreted Article 21's 'procedure established by law'

name: State of Madras v. Champakam Dorairajan
description: Led to the First Amendment of the Constitution, which empowered the state to make special provisions for socially disadvantaged groups

name: Balsara v. Bombay
description: Upheld state's right to prohibit alcohol under directive principles, validating Bombay Prohibition Act

name: K.M. Nanavati v. State of Maharashtra
description: Famous case that led to the abolition of the jury system in India after a controversial acquittal was overturned

name: Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala
description: Landmark judgment establishing that Parliament cannot amend the basic structure of the Constitution

name: ADM Jabalpur v. Shivakant Shukla
key_finding: Fundamental rights can be suspended during emergency
description: Controversial ruling that fundamental rights could be suspended during emergency, later overruled

name: Maneka Gandhi v. Union of India
key_finding: Expanded interpretation of right to life
description: Landmark judgment that expanded Article 21 to include right to dignity, livelihood, privacy, and due process

name: Hussainara Khatoon v. State of Bihar
description: Established the right to speedy trial as part of fundamental rights, addressing the issue of undertrials

name: Minerva Mills v. Union of India
key_finding: Balance between fundamental rights and directive principles
description: Struck down amendments giving primacy to directive principles over fundamental rights, reinforcing basic structure doctrine

name: Bachan Singh v. State of Punjab
key_finding: 'Rarest of rare' doctrine for death penalty
description: Established that death penalty should be imposed only in 'rarest of rare' cases

name: Olga Tellis v. Bombay Municipal Corporation
key_finding: Right to livelihood as part of right to life
description: Recognized that the right to livelihood is part of the right to life under Article 21

name: Shah Bano v. Mohd. Ahmed Khan
description: Controversial ruling on Muslim woman's right to maintenance under Section 125 of CrPC, later nullified by Muslim Women Act

name: M.C. Mehta v. Union of India (Oleum Gas Leak)
description: Established the principle of absolute liability without exceptions for hazardous industries

name: D.K. Basu v. State of West Bengal
description: Established detailed guidelines for arrest, detention, and interrogation by police officials

name: Central Inland Water v. Brojo Nath
description: Established that unconscionable contractual terms can be struck down by courts

name: Indra Sawhney v. Union of India
description: Upheld 27% reservation for Other Backward Classes (OBCs) but struck down reservation in promotions

name: Vishaka v. State of Rajasthan
description: Established guidelines for prevention of sexual harassment at workplace before legislation was enacted

name: Supreme Court Advocates-on-Record Association v. Union of India
description: Established the 'collegium system' for appointment of judges, giving primacy to judiciary

name: Lily Thomas v. Union of India
description: Held that conversion solely for the purpose of marriage without true faith is invalid

name: Narmada Bachao Andolan v. Union of India
key_finding: Development projects can proceed with safeguards
description: Allowed the Sardar Sarovar Project to proceed with certain environmental and rehabilitation safeguards

name: PUCL v. Union of India
key_finding: Right to food as fundamental right
description: Recognized the right to food as part of the right to life under Article 21

name: Avtar Singh Bhasin v. State of Karnataka
key_finding: Maintenance must be commensurate with lifestyle
description: Established that maintenance amount should be proportional to the previous lifestyle of the spouse

name: People's Union for Civil Liberties v. Union of India
description: Introduced the 'None of the Above' (NOTA) option in elections

name: Prakash Singh v. Union of India
description: Mandated significant reforms in police organization and functioning across states

name: M. Nagaraj v. Union of India
key_finding: Reservations in promotions constitutional with conditions
description: Held that reservation in promotions is constitutional subject to proving backwardness, inadequate representation, and efficiency

name: Ashoka Kumar Thakur v. Union of India
key_finding: OBC reservations in educational institutions valid
description: Upheld 27% OBC reservation in central educational institutions

name: Naz Foundation v. Govt of NCT of Delhi
description: Decriminalized consensual homosexual acts, later overruled by Supreme Court in 2013

name: Aruna Shanbaug v. Union of India
description: Permitted passive euthanasia in certain circumstances through withdrawal of life support

name: Selvi v. State of Karnataka
description: Held that narco-analysis, brain-mapping, and polygraph tests without consent violate Article 20(3)

name: Suresh Kumar Koushal v. Naz Foundation
description: Overturned Delhi High Court judgment, recriminalizing homosexuality, later overruled in 2018

name: NALSA v. Union of India
key_finding: Recognition of transgender as third gender
description: Recognized transgender persons as a third gender and affirmed their fundamental rights

name: Shreya Singhal v. Union of India
key_finding: Section 66A of IT Act struck down
description: Struck down Section 66A of Information Technology Act as unconstitutional restriction on free speech

name: Justice K.S. Puttaswamy v. Union of India
key_finding: Right to privacy as fundamental right
description: Nine-judge bench unanimously declared right to privacy as a fundamental right

name: Triple Talaq Case
description: Declared instantaneous triple talaq (talaq-e-biddat) as unconstitutional

name: Navtej Singh Johar v. Union of India
description: Decriminalized consensual homosexual acts by reading down Section 377

name: Indian Young Lawyers Association v. State of Kerala
key_finding: Women's entry into Sabarimala temple allowed
description: Struck down ban on entry of women of menstruating age into Sabarimala temple

name: Rafale Deal Case
description: Dismissed petitions seeking probe into Rafale fighter jet deal, finding no irregularities

name: Ayodhya Land Dispute Case
description: Allocated disputed land for construction of Ram temple, alternative plot for mosque

name: Anuradha Bhasin v. Union of India
description: Declared internet access as part of freedom of speech, mandated review of internet shutdowns

name: Arnab Goswami v. State of Maharashtra
description: Reinforced the principle of 'bail, not jail', emphasizing liberty of citizens

name: Tehseen Poonawalla v. Union of India
description: Issued preventive, remedial, and punitive guidelines for mob lynching cases

name: Pegasus Spyware Case
description: Formed expert committee to investigate alleged use of Pegasus spyware for surveillance

name: Jarnail Singh v. Lachhmi Narain Gupta
description: Extended 'creamy layer' principle to promotions for SC/ST employees

name: X v. State of Jharkhand
key_finding: Marital rape recognized in MTP Act
description: Recognized marital rape for the purpose of Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act

name: Environmental Compensation Case
description: Strengthened implementation of 'polluter pays' principle for environmental damage

name: LIC v. Consumer Education & Research Centre
description: Extended liability of insurance companies in consumer disputes

name: Digital News Publishers Association v. Union of India
description: Struck down certain provisions of IT Rules, 2021 affecting digital news publishers

name: EWS Reservation Case
description: Upheld the constitutional validity of 10% reservation for Economically Weaker Sections

name: Goa Mining Case
description: Established guidelines for renewal of mining leases with environmental safeguards

name: Kharak Singh v. State of Uttar Pradesh
description: First case to recognize aspects of privacy as part of personal liberty, albeit limited

name: Raj Narain v. Indira Gandhi
description: Invalidated Indira Gandhi's election, leading to declaration of Emergency

name: Rudul Sah v. State of Bihar
description: First case awarding compensation for violation of fundamental rights by the state

name: State of Karnataka v. Appa Balu Ingale
description: Recognized and addressed the issue of atrocities against Dalits under the SC/ST Act

name: Ratlam Municipality v. Vardhichand
key_finding: Public interest enforcement of municipal duties
description: Enforced municipal duties towards public health and sanitation through judicial orders

name: Mohd. Ahmed Khan v. Shah Bano Begum
description: Reignited debate on Uniform Civil Code while deciding on maintenance for Muslim divorced women

name: Common Cause v. Union of India
description: Early case dealing with right to die with dignity, leading to later passive euthanasia rulings

name: Vineet Narain v. Union of India
description: Established guidelines for ensuring CBI's autonomy from political interference

name: Narmada Bachao Andolan v. Union of India
description: Balanced development needs with displacement and environmental concerns in dam projects

name: S.R. Bommai v. Union of India
description: Established limits on imposition of President's rule under Article 356

name: Rubabbuddin Sheikh v. State of Gujarat
description: Landmark judgment on handling of fake encounter cases and police accountability

name: Aruna Rodrigues v. Union of India
description: Established regulatory framework for Genetically Modified crops in India

name: Nandini Sundar v. State of Chhattisgarh
description: Declared Salwa Judum (state-sponsored vigilante groups) as unconstitutional

name: Centre for PIL v. Union of India (2G Spectrum)
description: Cancelled 122 telecom licenses in the 2G spectrum case due to arbitrary allocation

name: Society for Unaided Private Schools v. Union of India
description: Upheld constitutional validity of Right to Education Act with exemption for minority institutions

name: PUCL v. Union of India (Aadhar Case)
description: Restricted mandatory use of Aadhar to certain welfare schemes until larger bench decision

name: Namit Sharma v. Union of India
description: Established guidelines for appointment of RTI Commissioners

name: Subramanian Swamy v. Union of India
description: Upheld constitutional validity of criminal defamation under IPC Sections 499 and 500

name: Common Cause v. Union of India (Living Will)
key_finding: Living will and advance directives legal
description: Legalized living wills and advance medical directives for passive euthanasia

name: Swapnil Tripathi v. Supreme Court of India
description: Allowed live streaming of Supreme Court proceedings of constitutional importance

name: Mukesh Singh v. State (NCT of Delhi)
key_finding: Death penalty in Nirbhaya case upheld
description: Upheld death penalty for convicts in the 2012 Delhi gang rape case

name: Foundation for Media Professionals v. Union Territory of J&K
description: Mandated review of 4G internet restrictions in Jammu and Kashmir

name: Laxman Naskar v. Union of India
key_finding: Marital rape as ground for divorce
description: Recognized marital rape as cruelty for the purpose of divorce

name: In Re: Distribution of Essential Supplies During Pandemic
description: Established judicial oversight over government's COVID-19 management

name: Samta Andolan v. Union of India
description: Clarified application of reservation in promotion for public services

name: Association for Democratic Reforms v. Union of India
description: Scrutinized electoral bonds scheme for political party funding

name: Zakia Jafri v. State of Gujarat
description: Ruled on investigation into larger conspiracy behind 2002 Gujarat riots

name: Parsi Marriage and Divorce Case
description: Modernized interpretation of Parsi personal law for gender equality

name: Digital Personal Data Protection Act Case
description: Established principles for implementing Digital Personal Data Protection Act

name: State of Punjab v. Ajaib Singh
description: Early case establishing procedures for preventive detention under security laws

name: Ram Jawaya Kapur v. State of Punjab
description: Established limits of executive power without legislative backing

name: Shankari Prasad v. Union of India
description: Early case on judicial review of constitutional amendments

name: Romesh Thapar v. State of Madras
description: Expanded interpretation of freedom of press under Article 19

name: Unnikrishnan v. State of Andhra Pradesh
description: Recognized right to education as part of right to life before it became explicit fundamental right

name: State of Punjab v. Gurmit Singh
description: Established guidelines for handling testimony of rape victims

name: Sarla Mudgal v. Union of India
description: Ruled against conversion to Islam solely for the purpose of second marriage

name: Kihoto Hollohan v. Zachillhu
description: Defined scope and application of anti-defection law

name: Lillu v. State of Haryana
description: Declared the two-finger test for rape victims as unconstitutional

name: Gautam Navlakha v. State of Delhi
description: Established protections for human rights defenders against arbitrary detention

name: Youth Bar Association v. Union of India
description: Mandated upload of FIRs on police websites within 24 hours

name: Jagisha Arora v. State of UP
description: Established guidelines for arrest of journalists and media professionals

name: Farmers Protest Case
description: Affirmed right to peaceful protest while maintaining public order

name: MP Sugar Mills v. State of Uttar Pradesh
description: Limited administrative discretion in taxation matters requiring objective criteria

name: Ram Singh v. Union of India
description: Clarified application of military law vis-à-vis civilian law

name: Kuldip Nayar v. Union of India
description: Established procedures and safeguards in Rajya Sabha elections

name: P.V. Narasimha Rao v. State (CBI)
description: Defined limits of parliamentary privileges in corruption cases

name: Judge Loya Death Case
description: Addressed issues of judicial independence and investigation procedures

name: Crypto Currency Regulation Case
description: Established regulatory framework for cryptocurrency operations in India

name: I.C. Golaknath v. State of Punjab
description: First case to limit Parliament's power to amend fundamental rights

name: Charles Sobraj v. Superintendent of Central Jail
description: Established rights of prisoners including right to fair treatment

name: Pro-CAA Protests Case
description: Established constitutional limits and protections for public protests

name: Sabarimala Review Petition
description: Addressed balance between religious practices and constitutional rights of equality

name: Uniform Civil Code Reference
description: Addressed constitutional framework for potential Uniform Civil Code implementation
